data.title: ESTI Preschool in Krakow
data.meta_description: ESTI Preschool in Krakow: Your child's ideal development hub. Games, learning, and care from our Polish school. Give them the best start in life.
data.text:
Laurence Preater

Teacher preschool

Qualifications:

Master of Linguistics, teacher of English, Spanish and foreign literature

Professional Background:

Teaching has been my lifelong passion, and I feel incredibly fortunate to have 22 years of experience in this rewarding field. I began my journey as an English teacher, completing my education at Kyiv National Linguistic University. It was a fulfilling experience that laid a strong foundation for my teaching career. Five years ago, I embraced a new adventure and moved to China, where I found my first opportunity to teach young learners in an international setting. This experience has been truly enriching and has reaffirmed my love for teaching. As I embark on my 22nd year of teaching, I am thrilled to join the vibrant community of Esti School, looking forward to new challenges and inspiring young minds for years to come

About me

As a devoted mother to a delightful ten-year-old boy, my life is filled with joy and excitement. Together, we share a passion for cooking and often experiment with new recipes in the kitchen. Additionally, our love for exploring different cultures has led us to embark on memorable adventures. Having lived in China for two years, I developed a deep appreciation for Asian culture, which has inspired my son's curiosity as well. With each passing day, I am grateful for the meaningful moments shared with my son and the joy that fills our lives.My Teaching Approach: Building Strong ConnectionsAs a teacher, I focus on building strong relationships with my students. I enjoy talking to them about things that matter to them and learning about their experiences and feelings. My classroom is like a friendly community where we share ideas and learn from each other together

Qualifications:

CELTA

BA Philosophy

Professional Background:

Following my CELTA qualification, I transitioned into teaching at an arts-centered high school in Prague, where I further refined my teaching techniques and approaches. Subsequently, I ventured into private online tuition, broadening my scope and reaching students from diverse backgrounds. Concurrently, I pursued higher education with the Open University, delving into Philosophy and Arts, which enriched my understanding of interdisciplinary approaches to education.

My approach to work:

My teaching philosophy revolves around fostering mutual respect and cooperation in the classroom, regardless of the students' age or background. I firmly believe that creating a nurturing environment where students feel comfortable and encouraged to express themselves is essential for their holistic development. By prioritizing individualized attention and cultivating a sense of curiosity and autonomy, I aim to instill a lifelong love for learning in my students.

About me:

I am passionate about teaching and facilitating learning experiences that empower students to reach their full potential. My journey in education has been shaped by diverse experiences, including volunteer work as an English teacher for refugees in Greece. This experience ignited my passion for teaching children and underscored the importance of creating inclusive and supportive learning environments.

Magdalena Krawczyk

Teacher's assistant

Qualifications:

Master of Linguistics, teacher of English, Spanish and foreign literature

Professional Background:

Teaching has been my lifelong passion, and I feel incredibly fortunate to have 22 years of experience in this rewarding field. I began my journey as an English teacher, completing my education at Kyiv National Linguistic University. It was a fulfilling experience that laid a strong foundation for my teaching career. Five years ago, I embraced a new adventure and moved to China, where I found my first opportunity to teach young learners in an international setting. This experience has been truly enriching and has reaffirmed my love for teaching. As I embark on my 22nd year of teaching, I am thrilled to join the vibrant community of Esti School, looking forward to new challenges and inspiring young minds for years to come

About me

As a devoted mother to a delightful ten-year-old boy, my life is filled with joy and excitement. Together, we share a passion for cooking and often experiment with new recipes in the kitchen. Additionally, our love for exploring different cultures has led us to embark on memorable adventures. Having lived in China for two years, I developed a deep appreciation for Asian culture, which has inspired my son's curiosity as well. With each passing day, I am grateful for the meaningful moments shared with my son and the joy that fills our lives.My Teaching Approach: Building Strong ConnectionsAs a teacher, I focus on building strong relationships with my students. I enjoy talking to them about things that matter to them and learning about their experiences and feelings. My classroom is like a friendly community where we share ideas and learn from each other together

Qualifications:

Certificate in Preschool Teacher Assistant from a vocational school. Ongoing professional development through courses like Kinesiology and Story Therapy.

Professional Background:

My professional journey in childcare has been rich and diverse, encompassing roles in both preschool and daycare settings. I have acquired a solid foundation in early childhood education. Furthermore, I am committed to continuous professional growth and stay abreast of the latest developments in the field. With each experience, I have gained valuable insights and skills that have further fueled my passion for creating meaningful and impactful learning experiences for children.

My approach to work:

In my approach to work, I am guided by a strong sense of responsibility and a genuine commitment to the well-being of the children under my care. I believe in fostering a nurturing atmosphere that not only stimulates intellectual growth but also nurtures emotional and social development. By cultivating a sense of curiosity and wonder, I aim to instill a lifelong love of learning in each child. Collaboration with parents and colleagues is integral to my approach, as I recognize the importance of building strong partnerships to support the holistic development of every child.

About me:

I am a dedicated and compassionate individual with a deep-seated passion for enriching the lives of children through education and care. My journey in working with children spans many years, during which I have honed my skills and embraced the joy that comes with nurturing young minds. I thrive on creativity and constantly seek new ways to engage children in meaningful learning experiences. With a warm and approachable demeanor, I strive to create a supportive and inclusive environment where every child feels valued and encouraged to explore their potential.
